name: Daily Ops Digest
description: A daily morning digest (and optional pre-bed check) that summarizes what happened and what to do next.

install_inputs.label: Where should the digest be posted?
What should the digest focus on?

agents.purpose: TPM-style daily summary with next actions.
agents.notes: Great default for non-technical users; focuses on clarity and priorities.

agents.purpose: General operator; used for optional pre-bedtime check.
agents.notes: Fallback agent if other agent ids are missing.

payload.message:
You are running the Daily Ops Digest Starter Pack.

Focus: {{focus}}

Produce a concise morning digest:
1) Overnight activity: what changed since yesterday (major threads, decisions, or alerts).
2) Today's docket: top priorities (max 5) + who owns each.
3) Scheduled automations: which cron jobs will run today and what they do.
4) Risks/blockers: what needs attention.
5) Suggested next actions: 3 concrete actions.

If you lack context, ask exactly 3 questions to set this up (where to look, what to summarize, who the audience is) and stop.

Quick pre-bedtime ops check:
1) What work is currently in progress?
2) Do active agents have clear instructions overnight?
3) Any blockers needing attention before tomorrow?

Keep it brief.

example_prompts: Install the Daily Ops Digest pack and post it to #ops.
Run the Daily Ops Digest now and keep it under 12 bullets.
Change the digest to include GitHub PRs and CI failures.
Enable only the morning digest and keep the pre-bed check disabled.
